org.parosproxy.paros.core.scanner

Interface Plugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAppParamPlugin, AbstractAppPlugin, AbstractDefaultFilePlugin, AbstractHostPlugin, AbstractPlugin, ScriptsActiveScanner

    public interface Plugin
extends Runnable
    This interface must be implemented by a Plugin for running the checks. The AbstractHostPlugin, AbstractAppPlugin, AbstractAppParamPlugin implement this interface and is a good starting point for writing new plugins.

    • Nested Class Summary

        String[] getDependency()
        Array of dependency of this plugin. This plugin will start running until all the dependency completed running. The dependency is the class name.
        Returns:
        null if there is no dependency.

      • getAlertThreshold

        Plugin.AlertThreshold getAlertThreshold(boolean incDefault)
        The alert threshold for this plugin, ie the level of certainty required to report an alert
        Parameters:
        incDefault - if the DEFAULT level should be returned as DEFAULT as opposed to the value of the default level
        Returns:
        The alert threshold currently set for this plugin

      • getAlertThreshold

        Plugin.AlertThreshold getAlertThreshold()
        The alert threshold for this plugin, ie the level of certainty required to report an alert. The DEFAULT level will not be returned, instead the value of the default level will be returned, if relevant.
        Returns:
        The alert threshold for this plugin

      • setAlertThreshold

        void setAlertThreshold(Plugin.AlertThreshold level)
        Set the alert threshold for this plugin, ie the level of certainty required to report an alert
        Parameters:
        level - The alert threshold to set for this plugin

      • setDefaultAlertThreshold

        void setDefaultAlertThreshold(Plugin.AlertThreshold level)
        Set the default alert threshold for this plugin, ie the level of certainty required to report an alert
        Parameters:
        level - The alert threshold to set for this plugin

      • getAlertThresholdsSupported

        Plugin.AlertThreshold[] getAlertThresholdsSupported()
        Returns an array of the AlertThresholds supported. It must include MEDIUM and may include LOW and HIGH OFF and DEFAULT are assumed and should not be returned.
        Returns:

      • getAttackStrength

        Plugin.AttackStrength getAttackStrength(boolean incDefault)
        Returns the AttackStrength, which is an indication of the relative number of requests the plugin will make against a given target
        Parameters:
        incDefault - if the DEFAULT level should be returned as DEFAULT as opposed to the value of the default level
        Returns:
        The AttackStrength currently set for this plugin

      • getAttackStrength

        Plugin.AttackStrength getAttackStrength()
        Returns the AttackStrength, which is an indication of the relative number of requests the plugin will make against a given target. The DEFAULT level will not be returned, instead the value of the default level will be returned, if relevant.
        Returns:
        The AttackStrength currently set for this plugin

      • setAttackStrength

        void setAttackStrength(Plugin.AttackStrength level)
        Set the attack strength for this plugin, ie the relative number of requests the plugin will make against a given target.
        Parameters:
        level - The alert threshold to set for this plugin

      • setDefaultAttackStrength

        void setDefaultAttackStrength(Plugin.AttackStrength strength)
        Set the default attack strength for this plugin, ie the relative number of attacks that will be performed
        Parameters:
        strength - The attack strength to set for this plugin

      • getAttackStrengthsSupported

        Plugin.AttackStrength[] getAttackStrengthsSupported()
        Returns an array of the AttackStrengths supported. It must include MEDIUM and may include LOW, HIGH and INSANE DEFAULT is assumed and should not be returned.
        Returns:

      • setTechSet

        void setTechSet(TechSet ts)
        Sets the technologies enabled for the scan. Might be null when all technologies are enabled.
        Parameters:
        ts - the technologies enabled for the scan
        See Also:
        targets(TechSet)

      • inScope

        boolean inScope(Tech tech)
        Tells whether or not the given technology is enabled for the scan.

        Helper method to check if a technology is enabled before performing the scan.

        Parameters:
        tech - the technology that will be checked
        Returns:
        true if the technology is enabled for the scan, false otherwise
        See Also:
        targets(TechSet)

      • targets

        boolean targets(TechSet technologies)
        Tells whether or not the scanner targets the given technologies to be run. If the scanner does not target a specific technology is should return, always, true so the scanner is run independently of the technologies enabled.

        Scanners that target multiple technologies must check which technologies are enabled before performing the actual scans.

        Parameters:
        technologies - the technologies that are enabled for the scan, never null
        Returns:
        true if the scanner is targeting the given technologies (or none at all), false otherwise
        See Also:
        setTechSet(TechSet), inScope(Tech)
